injuries.shortComment: Thomas has entered the league's health and safety protocols.
injuries.longComment: Thomas joined the Mavericks on a 10-day hardship contract Wednesday but will land in the COVID-19 protocols a day after making his team debut. It's not yet clear whether he's tested positive for the virus or when he'll be able to return.

injuries.shortComment: Knight entered COVID-19 protocols Wednesday, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: Knight was on a hardship deal, so this is a tough blow for him and the Mavericks. The organization countered by adding Isaiah Thomas on a 10-day deal.

injuries.shortComment: Marjanovic was placed in the league's health and safety protocols Wednesday, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: Marjanovic and Brandon Knight were the latest Mavericks to be sidelined due to COVID-19 protocols, bringing Dallas' total to nine players currently sidelined. In Marjanovic's absence, Moses Brown and Marquese Chriss will likely be the primary backups to starting center Dwight Powell.

injuries.shortComment: Cauley-Stein (personal) will not play Monday against Portland.
injuries.longComment: The big man continues to tend to a personal matter, and Monday will mark his 15th straight absence. At this stage, it's completely unclear when Cauley-Stein will return to the team.

injuries.shortComment: The Mavericks announced Sunday that they have requested waivers on Omoruyi (toe).
injuries.longComment: Omoruyi recently underwent surgery on his right big toe and is expected to be sidelined 4-6 months. The 24-year-old is expected to make a full recovery and will now need to wait 48 hours to clear waivers before he can sign with another team. Omoruyi averaged 1.8 points and 1.8 rebounds in four games with the Mavericks.

injuries.shortComment: McLaughlin (undisclosed) was placed in the league's health and safety protocols Thursday.
injuries.longComment: While it's not yet clear whether McLaughlin has tested positive for COVID-19, he'll be unavailable for Thursday's game against the Bucks. A timetable for his return isn't yet known.

injuries.shortComment: Doncic has entered the NBA's health and safety protocols, Shams Charania of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: This is a devastating blow for the Mavericks, who were hoping to get Doncic back from an ankle injury Thursday night against the Bucks and will now be without their superstar for an additional stretch of games. Unless Doncic can return a pair of negative tests within a 24-hour period, he'll almost certainly sit out Dallas' Christmas Day showdown against the Jazz. Given how much time other players have missed, Doncic should be expected to be sidelined for 7-to-10 days, which would rule him out for at lest four or five more contests.

injuries.shortComment: Burke was placed in the league's health and safety protocols Wednesday, source reports.
injuries.longComment: Tim MacMahon of ESPN.com reports that both Burke and Luka Doncic were placed in protocols as a result of a positive test. The Mavericks currently have six players out due to protocols and have signed or agreed to deals with six replacement players. With Burke expected to be sidelined for an extended period, recently signed Carlik Jones and Brandon Knight will have opportunities to crack Dallas' rotation.

injuries.shortComment: Kleber has been placed in the league's health and safety protocols.
injuries.longComment: It's not yet clear whether Kleber has tested positive for COVID-19, but he'll need to spend some time away from the team. Dorian Finney-Smith and Marquese Chriss are in line for increased playing time in his absence.
